title: Improve message for errors that occur while parsing attributes

labels.name: type/enhancement
labels.description: A new idea that should be implemented

body:
By (carelessly) doubling the `Test` attribute (but I imagine it could also be valid for others, I don't know), PHPUnit correctly generates an error, but does not report any useful indication on where to intervene.

At this point it becomes impossible to even run a simple `phpunit -v` (but I know I'm using `11.5.6`).
Even using the `-vvvv` option does not yield any useful information.

Would it be possible to indicate the line of code in a future version?

```bash
> phpunit --colors=always


An error occurred inside PHPUnit.

Message:  Attribute "PHPUnit\Framework\Attributes\Test" must not be repeated
Location: /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Metadata/Parser/AttributeParser.php:404

#0 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Metadata/Parser/AttributeParser.php(404): ReflectionAttribute->newInstance()
#1 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Metadata/Parser/ParserChain.php(58): PHPUnit\Metadata\Parser\AttributeParser->forMethod()
#2 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Metadata/Parser/CachingParser.php(77): PHPUnit\Metadata\Parser\ParserChain->forMethod()
#3 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Metadata/Parser/CachingParser.php(95): PHPUnit\Metadata\Parser\CachingParser->forMethod()
#4 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Metadata/Api/Requirements.php(56): PHPUnit\Metadata\Parser\CachingParser->forClassAndMethod()
#5 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestBuilder.php(285): PHPUnit\Metadata\Api\Requirements->requirementsNotSatisfiedFor()
#6 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestBuilder.php(46): PHPUnit\Framework\TestBuilder->requirementsSatisfied()
#7 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestSuite.php(508): PHPUnit\Framework\TestBuilder->build()
#8 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestSuite.php(109): PHPUnit\Framework\TestSuite->addTestMethod()
#9 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestSuite.php(209): PHPUnit\Framework\TestSuite::fromClassReflector()
#10 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/Framework/TestSuite.php(230): PHPUnit\Framework\TestSuite->addTestSuite()
#11 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/TextUI/Configuration/Xml/TestSuiteMapper.php(105): PHPUnit\Framework\TestSuite->addTestFile()
#12 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/TextUI/Configuration/TestSuiteBuilder.php(75): PHPUnit\TextUI\XmlConfiguration\TestSuiteMapper->map()
#13 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/TextUI/Application.php(418): PHPUnit\TextUI\Configuration\TestSuiteBuilder->build()
#14 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/src/TextUI/Application.php(181): PHPUnit\TextUI\Application->buildTestSuite()
#15 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/phpunit/phpunit/phpunit(104): PHPUnit\TextUI\Application->run()
#16 /home/mirko/Server/climat/vendor/bin/phpunit(122): include('...')
#17 {main}
Script phpunit --colors=always handling the test event returned with error code 255
```
